title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez sentenced to federal prison for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months imprisonment, while Baez was sentenced to two years, both with supervised release terms.
The scheme involved stealing checks from USPS boxes, altering them, and depositing into their controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE in 2025, invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes, detained as a collateral arrest targeting his father, was released on $2,000 bond after six days in custody.
Gomes' arrest led to community support protests; his detention highlighted issues within the U.S. immigration system.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's Olympic win over Denmark, later joking about the incident.
Swayman admitted losing sight of the puck, attributing it to tricky lighting conditions and his own colorblindness.
Despite the goal, the U.S. team secured victory, with Swayman making 18 saves and facing competition from two other goaltenders.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum is nearing a return from an Achilles injury, missing All-Star weekend for the first time in six years.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony express high expectations for Tatum's impact on the Celtics if he returns this season.
Tatum practiced with the Celtics' G League team, potentially returning in weeks, strengthening Boston's playoff position.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space for offseason signings, targeting positions of need.
Potential signings include Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker for strategic upgrades.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips are notable free agent targets for Patriots.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV have partnered, making ESPN the new streaming home for MLB games.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99 a season; non-subscribers pay $149.99 with a free month trial.
Current MLB.TV subscribers can renew automatically; viewing available via ESPN or MLB app with linked accounts.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics, raising hopes of a potential return this season.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, indicating he "looked like Jayson Tatum" during practice.
Celtics President Brad Stevens insists Tatum won't return until he's "110 percent" ready, despite growing speculation of his comeback.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. according to a 2026 WalletHub study.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, while nearly 22% have a graduate or professional degree.
Vermont and Maryland were second and third, with Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia at the bottom of the list.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Honus Wagner's rare T206 card from early 1900s is up for auction, closing February 21.
Card was pulled from a cigarette pack by Morton Bernstein, who later ran a Taunton, MA silver plant.
The ungraded card's auction bid is $3.9 million, with a buyer's premium raising it to $4.758 million.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman to make Olympic debut for Team USA against Denmark, starting as goalie in Saturday's game.
Swayman helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, improving his standing for the 2026 Olympics.
Charlie McAvoy, another Bruins player, is set to join Swayman on the ice in Saturday's match against Denmark.
